article:
It was no wonder I was not looking forward to entering the ninth grade. High school is well known for being a battleground, where everyone seems to be   _   through physical changes and emotional mood swings . For me,   _   was my punishment.
I had always   _   insecure and out of place as one of the   _   members of my class, standing a head above the other girls and standing at the   _   of the line to avoid sticking   _  .
I especially hate being around large groups of   _  , like during the social hour after services at my church.   _   the prayers were finished, I would   _   as quickly as possible so I could   _   some well-meaning congratulations, "Ruthie! Look how tall you're getting!"
My grandfather would watch me   _   increasingly uncomfortable, but he did not   _   at my self-consciousness  or try to comfort me.   _  , he would remind me. "Stand   _   and tall," he would say, as I   _   tried to shrink  myself. Even at age 15, I understood that his advice was about   _   than just feet and inches.
My grandfather   travelled   in war-torn Europe. When German soldiers   _   his hometown, he joined the army to   fight for   his country's freedom. "Stand straight, stand tall,"   _   something else back then.
